job_history.work_description: Responsible for inspection, testing and maintenance of electrical, electronic and HVAC systems on rolling stock equipment in accordance with FRA and Amtrak standards and guidelines.
Repair, recondition, service, and maintain Uninteruptable Power Supply systems and other power systems related components. Troubleshoot and diagnose malfunctions of the complete power systems.

job_history.role_name: Electrical Work Center Supervisor/1st Lieutenant Supervisor
job_history.work_description: Supervises 13 personnel performing scheduled and unscheduled maintenance on flight control, instrumentation, navigation and electrical systems on 17 F/A-18C/D/E/F and 3 EA-18G aircraft. Supervises 9 Sailors responsible for the daily upkeep of squadron facilities and the stocking, inventory and sales of squadron store merchandise.

Managed the administrative and production efforts of 59 avionics technicians. Performing intermediate level repair of H-60, H-53, AV-8, UH-1, and AH-1 aircraft systems and components. Responsible for the check in and training of all newly assigned Sailors, receiving all their initial shipboard qualifications.

Responsible for the administrative and production efforts of 34 avionics technicians. Performing intermediate level repair on P-3 and H-60 aircraft, electrical and power generation systems and components.

job_history.role_name: Aviation Electrician Shift Supervisor/Avionics Technician Shift Supervisor
job_history.work_description: Supervised 3 Sailors performing scheduled/unscheduled maintenance and corrosion prevention and treatment on 7 SH-60F/HH-60H helicopters. Responsible for troubleshooting and repair of Electrical/Instrument and Automatic Flight Control Systems.

Performed scheduled/unscheduled maintenance and corrosion prevention and treatment on 7 SH-60F/HH-60H helicopters. Performed intermediate level component and system repair on electrical and power generation systems for P-3, S-3, and H-60 aircraft.

skills.name: Electrical Systems Maintenance
skills.explanation: Extensive experience in inspection, testing, and maintenance of electrical systems on rolling stock equipment, aircraft, and helicopters, indicating expert-level mastery.

skills.name: HVAC Systems Maintenance
skills.explanation: Experience in maintenance of HVAC systems on rolling stock equipment, suggesting strong proficiency.

skills.name: Power Systems Repair
skills.explanation: Experience in repair and maintenance of power systems, including Uninterruptable Power Supply systems, indicating strong proficiency.

skills.name: Avionics Systems Repair
skills.explanation: Extensive experience in intermediate-level repair of avionics systems and components on various aircraft, indicating expert-level mastery.

skills.name: Leadership
skills.explanation: Extensive experience in supervising personnel, including teams of up to 59 avionics technicians, indicating expert-level leadership skills.

skills.name: Troubleshooting
skills.explanation: Experience in troubleshooting and diagnosing malfunctions of complex systems, including electrical and power generation systems, indicating expert-level mastery.

skills.name: Project Management
skills.explanation: Experience in managing administrative and production efforts of teams, suggesting strong proficiency in project management.

skills.name: Quality Control
skills.explanation: Experience in ensuring compliance with standards and guidelines, including FRA and Amtrak standards, suggesting strong proficiency in quality control.
